intro: Matelea matezkii, commonly known as the Mexican candlewood, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Matelea matezkii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
